title: (x) "David Arquette" serif face on Scream movie poster - Adobe Garamond {Jacob Sievers}
content:
also located on the scream movie poster, but at the bottom.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [scream\_movie\_poster.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091205085830/http:/typophile.com/files/scream_movie_poster.jpg) | 28.13 KB |
author: andrei08

comments.content:
I think this may be the same as the other font, just not squooshed. And my previous guess of Caslon Antique doesn’t work, since the ’Q’ is different.

- Lex

I’m sure there’s an actual better font of this.. so far all I had found was this free one from da font that is somewhat similar.. I’m assuming this Roman Antique is probably based off of whatever is in your sample.  
 [http://www.dafont.com/font.php?file=roman\_antique&page=1&nb\_ppp\_old=10&t...](http://web.archive.org/web/20091205085830/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=roman_antique&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=DAVID+ARQUETTE&nb_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha "http://www.dafont.com/font.php?file=roman\_antique&page=1&nb\_ppp\_old=10&text=DAVID+ARQUETTE&nb\_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha")

Kris Todd  
Graphic Designer  
 [www.kasinkris.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20091205085830/http:/www.kasinkris.com/ "www.kasinkris.com")  
Twitter: @KasinKris

If the poster is this:  
 [http://www.cinemasterpieces.com/screamjan08.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091205085830/http:/www.cinemasterpieces.com/screamjan08.jpg "http://www.cinemasterpieces.com/screamjan08.jpg")  
the roughness is just compression artifacts.
Yes, same as the top: Adobe Garamond.
